channel.title: Connection Error - Retrying in [] (Detailed)
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape. I'm quite new to these forums, and quite to RSPS hosting, however, I'm pretty old in the Runescape world. Anyways, I have a major problem that I've been working a day+ on to try to fix, but can't.
Everytime I open my html, the java loads, however, the client says 'Connection Error - Retrying in [Seconds]. I've googled this and looked pretty hard for an answer. I cannot find one. I follow Ric's Webclient tutorial for 317 servers. It works good, except for this problem. I have portforwarded both UDP and TCP prt 43594. My download link is correct, and it is a direct download. My server ip is the corrent no-ip. I've been wasting my time trying to fix this problem. If anyone could please help, it would be GREATLY appreciated. Thanks!

item.title: Connection Error - Retrying in [] (Detailed)
item.dc:creator: @salecko salecko
item.description:
@salecko wrote:

It hasn’t downloaded the cache at all yet, because it can’t find the download link or it has some problem connecting to the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Retrying in [] (Detailed)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“salecko, post:4, topic:389904”]It is an uppercase ‘c’. And @ durial12

This is my own server. Well, not my server, but i’m hosting it. I’m wondering if I should be running some kind of bat while i try to run it?[/quote]

Alright then it’s a cache problem. It’s probably because t’s looking for the cache in directory A, when it downloaded in directory B.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Retrying in [] (Detailed)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“salecko, post:1, topic:389904”]Hello Moparscape. I’m quite new to these forums, and quite to RSPS hosting, however, I’m pretty old in the Runescape world. Anyways, I have a major problem that I’ve been working a day+ on to try to fix, but can’t.

Everytime I open my html, the java loads, however, the client says 'Connection Error - Retrying in [Seconds]. I’ve googled this and looked pretty hard for an answer. I cannot find one. I follow Ric’s Webclient tutorial for 317 servers. It works good, except for this problem. I have portforwarded both UDP and TCP prt 43594. My download link is correct, and it is a direct download. My server ip is the corrent no-ip. I’ve been wasting my time trying to fix this problem. If anyone could please help, it would be GREATLY appreciated. Thanks![/quote]

Is the ‘C’ in “Connection Error” uppercase or lowercase?

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error - Retrying in [] (Detailed)
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Welcome to the forums!

I’ve had this problem before. I would be on a client, and it works fine (meaning there is nothing wrong with variables etc). I would then try a different client and I would get this error. I always believed it to be something to do with the cache, but I could be wrong.

I’m sorry that I couldn’t be much help. Bumps this up if anything.

Do you have problems running other clients/webclients?

Read full topic
